channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hegseth reaffirms Vietnam partnership and hands over a leather box, belt and knife—wartime artifacts taken by U.S. soldiers
item.description: “Today we will exchange artifacts and information from the war with the goal of helping family members in both countries find peace.”

item.title: N.Y.C. Early Voting Ends With 735,000 Ballots Cast, as Younger Voters Surge
item.description: This year’s mayoral race saw the highest early in-person turnout ever for a nonpresidential election in New York.

item.title: Trump Administration Live Updates: Federal Judge Temporarily Blocks Guard Deployment in Portland
New Weapons Testing Ordered by Trump Won’t Include Nuclear Explosions, Wright Says
item.description: Energy Secretary Chris Wright said the testing ordered up in a surprise announcement by President Trump last week would focus on “the other parts” of ...

item.title: Defense Lawyers Demand Dismissal of Abuse Case Against Israeli Soldiers
item.description: The chief legal officer of Israel’s military resigned after authorizing the leak of a video in the case involving grave abuse of a Palestinian detaine...

item.title: Stock futures climb as investors await Supreme Court showdown on Trump tariffs and shareholder vote on Musk’s $1 trillion pay package
item.description: On Thursday, Tesla shareholders will gather for the company's annual meeting and will vote on Musk's $1 trillion compensation package.

item.title: Trump says immigration raid efforts ‘haven’t gone far enough’
item.description: Trump said the tactics used by immigration agents were acceptable “because you have to get the people out.”

item.title: 2025 New York City Marathon: Best Fashion Looks
item.description: Held on a Halloween weekend, this year’s race had a mother-and-daughter duo dressed as cows, a human-size banana and Ken (without Barbie).

item.title: Map: 6.3-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Afghanistan
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Defense Lawyers Demand Dismissal of Abuse Case Against Israeli Soldiers
item.description: The chief legal officer of Israel’s military resigned after authorizing the leak of a video in the case involving grave abuse of a Palestinian detaine...

item.title: Large Earthquake Strikes Northern Afghanistan
item.description: The 6.3-magnitude quake struck on Monday near Mazar-i-Sharif, a city known for its magnificent Blue Mosque. The extent of the damage was not immediate...

item.title: Transportation secretary says he doesn’t plan to fire air traffic controllers who don’t show up for work during shutdown
item.description: Before the shutdown, the FAA was already dealing with a long-standing shortage of about 3,000 air traffic controllers.

item.title: Fearing for her children’s safety, Mississippi woman shoots and kills escaped research monkey
item.description: “I shot at it and it just stood there, and I shot again, and he backed up and that's when he fell.”

item.title: For Day of the Dead, One Mexican Town Digs Up Its Dead
item.description: Pomuch, Mexico, is one of the last places where residents clean their relatives’ bones. Now they are grappling with a new challenge: tourists.

item.title: A Massacre Unfolding in Sudan
item.description: My colleague Declan Walsh writes about the humanitarian crisis in Darfur — and how the world is now largely looking away.
